intro: Thymus callieri, commonly known as the Sierra Madre thyme, is a species of flowering plant in the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple, and it has aromatic, narrow leaves that are used in traditional herbal medicine. Thymus callieri is a low-growing perennial shrub that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
